radiographic_examinations.findings: 40% proximal focal stenosis in the right coronary artery unchanged from previous angiogram; patent prior stent in the LCx distal to 3 serial 90% stenoses suggestive of 'beads on a string'.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Unchanged appearance of proximal LCx stenoses on repeat coronary angiography.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Resting perfusion defect in the basal to mid inferior and inferolateral walls, matching regions of hypokinesis, without evidence of late gadolinium enhancement.
Unchanged appearance of proximal LCx stenoses; no dissection, thrombosis, or atherosclerosis; mild in-stent restenosis without inflammatory changes.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Patent LCx stents without evidence of restenosis or new inflammatory disease at 6 months after discharge.
